titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Greenwood Baptist Church collection 1986.014
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-21T14:02-0500

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Greenwood Baptist Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Greenwood Baptist Church was established by a small prayer group in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Park Slope in 1858. Its first building was erected in 1863 at the corner of 4th Avenue and 15th Street. By the 1890s, the congregation had grown so substantially that the need for a larger building was recognized. In 1900, the church moved to a new edifice located at the corner of Sixth Street and Seventh Avenue in Park Slope, where it would remain throughout the 20th century. As of 2010, the church continues to occupy this location.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Greenwood Baptist Church. "History." Accessed November 5, 2010. http://www.greenwoodchurch.org/history
Greenwood Baptist Church. Program: The One Hundredth Anniversary of Greenwood Baptist Church. Brooklyn, N.Y.: Privately published, 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Greenwood Baptist Church collection spans the period 1954 to 1964 and contains printed items documenting the history and activities of the church. Materials include annual reports, newsletters, a publication on the church's 1956 Thanksgiving service, regular worship service programs, and programs for additional events, including the church's centennial celebration.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1986.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Greenwood Baptist Church collection, 1986.014, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
